meanings.definition: The charge made by a restaurant for serving wine that has been brought in by a customer.
meanings.sent1: The corkage at this restaurant is five dollars per bottle.
meanings.sent2: I had to pay corkage when I brought my own wine to dinner.
meanings.sent3: The waiter joked that the corkage fee was the 'price of freedom' for bringing my own wine.
meanings.sent4: The corkage charge felt like a toll booth on the road to a good meal.
meanings.sent5: The corkage fee was a reminder that saving money sometimes comes with a cost.
